topic: How to design ETL jobs using fastapi with Python 3.12+
prompt: Write a Python 3.12+ focused, accurate explainer for: How to design ETL jobs using fastapi with Python 3.12+

response_parsed.title: Designing ETL Jobs with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide demonstrates how to create and set up ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) jobs using FastAPI, a modern web framework for building APIs, and Python 3.12+. By the end of this tutorial, you will understand the basics of implementing an ETL pipeline with FastAPI.
key_points: Understanding the principles of ETL (Extract, Transform, Load) data pipelines
Setting up a new FastAPI project in Python 3.12+
Designing API endpoints for each stage of the ETL process (extract, transform, load)
Implementing data processing logic using libraries such as pandas and sqlalchemy
Creating a scheduler to automate the execution of ETL jobs

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI
app = FastAPI()
nodes = [] # sample data for ETL processing

from sqlalchemy import create_engine
# create a connection to the database

version_notes: This tutorial focuses on Python 3.12+ for its enhanced performance and new features
FastAPI version 0.71.0 is used in this example
caveats: Ensure you have the required libraries (FastAPI, sqlalchemy, pandas) installed before running the examples
This tutorial provides a basic ETL pipeline design; real-world applications may require additional considerations such as data validation, security, and scalability
